purpose: The email announces a two-year postdoctoral position in Empirical Software Engineering at Aarhus University, focusing on the adoption of human-centered AI in software engineering. It highlights the collaboration with industry and the research opportunities available, particularly in the context of Large Language Models. The email also outlines the qualifications required for applicants and provides details about the application process and the work environment.
evidence_sentences: The Section for Software Engineering and Computing Systems, at the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE), invites applicants for a two-year postdoctoral position within the area of Empirical Software Engineering (EMSE).
This position is funded by Innovation Fund Denmark Grand Solutions project "AI4SE1DK - Human-Centered Adoption of Artificial Intelligence for Software Engineering in Denmark".

You will be part of a team of researchers from leading Danish universities and practitioners from software companies in Denmark and Sweden jointly collaborating to advance the adoption of responsible and human-centered AI in software engineering (AI4SE).
The project will give you access to a rich ecosystem of researchers and practitioners, opportunities to publish in high-impact venues, and real-world validation of your research.
Applicants should hold a PhD degree in Computer Science or related field.
Applications must be received no later than 10 August 2025.
